business.headline: TCS to declare interim dividend today: Know record date and past dividendsTCS has already declared dividends totalling Rs 20 per share for FY25, with Rs 10 each announced in the first and second quarters.

Swiggy launches new standalone app SNACC. Here's all you need to know The app, which is currently available in select Bengaluru neighbourhoods, is aimed at urban consumers who prioritise speed and convenience when it comes to food delivery.

GDP growth in FY25 may hit 4-year low. Is Indian economy losing steam?While a slowdown in the ongoing financial year was anticipated, the steep downward revision in GDP growth for FY25 has taken many by surprise.

RBI's new credit reporting rules: Check how it will affect loan borrowersFrom January 1, 2025, RBI's bi-monthly credit updates aim to boost credit scores, empower borrowers, and improve lender risk assessments.

PAN card fraud: Know details, how to stay safe from phishing scamA new phishing scam claiming PAN card updates is targeting India Post Payments Bank customers, with PIB urging caution.

India's power output growth in 2024 slowest since pandemic: ReportThe deceleration was especially pronounced in the second half of the year, where power generation rose by only 2.3%, compared to a 9.6% rise in the first half.
Budget 2025: Can you expect Rs 10 lakh tax-free income?As Budget 2025 nears, the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh calls for tax reforms, pension hikes, and worker benefits to ease middle-class burdens.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Tirupati stampede: No ambulance at token centres amid huge rush, say sourcesA stampede at Tirumala's Lord Venkateswara Swamy temple left six dead and several injured. The stampede occurred as over 4,000 devotees gathered for special tokens.

5 dead, thousands flee US fires; Elon Musk offers free Starlink servicesBesides the iconic Hollywood sign, the Dolby Theatre, where the Oscar Awards ceremony is held annually, is also being threatened by the Sunset Fire. Other Los Angeles landmarks, including the Hollywood Bowl outdoor amphitheatre and the Hollywood Walk of Fame, are also in the line of danger.

Pak politician's jihad call against India slammed for risking peace possibilityComments by Anwar ul Haq, the Prime Minister of Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK), calling for jihad against India drew widespread condemnation.

Video: Biden's awkward 'good news' announcement at Los Angeles wildfire briefingThe President shared the "good news" of the birth of his great-grandchild while briefing the media at a Los Angeles fire station on Wednesday regarding the devastating Southern California wildfires.
Oscars 2025: Nominations delayed, voting extended due to Los Angeles wildfiresFollowing the deadly wildfires in Los Angeles, the Academy has extended the Oscar nomination voting window.

Misled by Google Maps, Assam cops enter Nagaland, get thrashed by localsAs the Assam cops, who were in civil dress, inadvertently crossed the border and entered Nagaland, the locals attacked them and held them captive for the night.

Siri spying on you for ads? Apple denies claims Apple's Siri has recently been blamed for spying on its users, but the company has denied all the allegations. The company claims that it has never used Siri data to build marketing profiles.

The bold kissing scene, actor Ram Kapoor's remarks and Ektaa Kapoor's fiery postRam Kapoor's recent revelations about the intimate scene in Bade Achhe Lagte Hain have reignited discussions, leading to a cryptic social media response from producer Ektaa Kapoor. The scene, which had previously sparked controversy and impacted the show's ratings, remains a significant moment in Indian television history.

Priyanka Gandhi is courteous unlike her brother, he smirked: Kangana RanautKangana Ranaut, who has invited Rahul Gandhi to watch her film Emergency, has said the Congress MP 'lacks etiquette'. However, she praised Priyanka Gandhi for being courteous. The film, based on Indira Gandhi, releases on January 17.

Same-sex marriage verdict to be reviewed by new Supreme Court bench todayThe petitioners have argued that the Supreme Court verdict, declining to accord legal recognition to same-sex marriages, compelled gay couples to remain in the closet.

He questioned the enthusiasm for technological advancements, calling for a slower, more thoughtful approach to decision-making.

Gracious in defeat, Alcaraz congratulates De Minaur on engagement Australian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz congratulated Alex de Minaur on his engagement with Katie Boulter last December. On Wednesday, Alcaraz lost to de Minaur in an exhibition match at the Melbourne Park.

West Ham United sack coach Julen Lopetegui, Graham Potter in talks for roleWest Ham United have announced that they have sacked head coach Julen Lopetegui after a poor first half to the season. Former Chelsea and Brighton manager Graham Potter is in talks to be the replacement for Lopetegui.

Indian Steve Smith? Young batter imitates Australian batter, watch videoIn a video on social media, a young batter imitated Australian cricket maestro Steve Smith with astonishing accuracy. Smith recently finished as the third-highest run-scorer in the Test series against India.

Not good for the game: Smith slams ILT20 for ignoring local cricketSA20 commissioner Graeme Smith has expressed concerns about the UAE's ILT20, stating that leagues of this nature are "not good for the game." Smith criticized the ILT20 for prioritizing international players over nurturing local talent, highlighting a lack of focus on developing the domestic cricketing ecosystem.

Rashford's camp arrives in Italy to hold talks with AC Milan: ReportsMarcus Rashford's representatives are in Italy for discussions with AC Milan over a potential loan deal. With Borussia Dortmund and other clubs also expressing interest, the Manchester United forward's future hangs in the balance after a difficult season under Ruben Amorim.

Rohit Sharma shouldn't play Tests anymore, he made wrong call in Sydney: KaifFormer batter Mohammad Kaif criticised Rohit Sharma's decision to sit out the final match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Rohit acknowledged his poor run with the bat and took the bold call. India lost the series finale by six wickets and conceded the coveted trophy to Australia.

Stronger than ever, Sabalenka aims for Australian Open hat-trickWorld No.1 Aryna Sabalenka had 2024 as her best year in her career. After starting 2025 with the Brisbane International title, the 26-year-old will be aiming to bag her third Australian Open title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
